00094 # Utilities
00095 
00096 
00097 def GetElementText(el, default=u''):
00098     if not el:
00099         return default
00100     text = default
00101     foundText = False
00102     el = el.firstChild
00103     while el:
00104         if el.nodeType == el.TEXT_NODE:
00105             value = el.nodeValue
00106             if not foundText:
00107                 # Replace the default with the first text.
00108                 foundText = True
00109                 text = value
00110             else:
00111                 text += value
00112         el = el.nextSibling
00113     return text
00114 
00115 
00116 def GetElementBool(el, default=False):
00117     if not el:
00118         return default
00119     text = GetElementText(el).lower()
00120     if text == 'true':
00121         return True
00122     if text == 'false':
00123         return False
00124     return default
00125 
00126 
00127 def GetElementInt(el, default=0):
00128     if not el:
00129         return default
00130     try:
00131         val = int(GetElementText(el))
00132     except:
00133         val = default
00134     return val
00135 
00136 
00137 def GetElementFloat(el, default=0.0):
00138     if not el:
00139         return default
00140     try:
00141         val = float(GetElementText(el))
00142     except:
00143         val = default
00144     return val
00145 
00146 
00147 def GetSubElement(el, key):
00148     # Isn't there a faster way to do this? (Only searching direct children.)
00149     el = el.firstChild
00150     while el:
00151         if ((el.nodeType == el.ELEMENT_NODE) and
00152             (el.nodeName == key)):
00153             return el
00154         el = el.nextSibling
00155     return None
00156 
00157 
00158 def GetSubElementText(el, key, default=u''):
00159     return GetElementText(GetSubElement(el, key), default)
00160 
00161 
00162 def GetSubElementBool(el, key, default=False):
00163     return GetElementBool(GetSubElement(el, key), default)
00164 
00165 
00166 def GetSubElementInt(el, key, default=0):
00167     return GetElementInt(GetSubElement(el, key), default)
00168 
00169 
00170 def GetSubElementFloat(el, key, default=0.0):
00171     return GetElementFloat(GetSubElement(el, key), default)
00172 
00173 
00174 def SetSubElementText(el, key, value):
00175     subEl = el.createElement(key)
00176     text = el.createTextNode(value)
00177     subEl.appendChild(text)
00178     el.appendChild(subEl)
00179 
00180 
00181 def SetSubElementBool(el, key, value):
00182     if value:
00183         value = 'true'
00184     else:
00185         value = 'false'
00186     SetSubElementText(el, key, value)
00187 
00188 
00189 def SetSubElementInt(el, key, value):
00190     SetSubElementText(el, key, str(value))
00191 
00192 
00193 def SetSubElementFloat(el, key, value):
00194     SetSubElementText(el, key, str(value))

00198 # CellModel Class
00199 
00200 
00201 class CellModel(cellengine.CellEngine):
00202 
00203 
00204     def __init__(
00205             self,
00206             running=True,
00207             timeDelay=100,
00208             *args,
00209             **kwargs):
00210 
00211         cellengine.CellEngine.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
00212 
00213         self.running = running
00214         self.timeDelay = timeDelay
00215         self.timerActive = False
00216         self.timerId = None
00217         self.views = []
00218 
00219 
00220         if self.running:
00221             self.startTimer()
00222 
00223         #print "CellModel.__init__ done", self
00224 
00225 
00226     def __del__(
00227         self):
00228 
00229         self.stopTimer()
00230 
00231         cellengine.Cell.__del__(self)
00232 
00233 
00234     def addView(self, view):
00235         views = self.views
00236         if view not in views:
00237             self.views.append(view)
00238             print "ADDVIEW", view
00239 
00240 
00241     def removeView(self, view):
00242         views = self.views
00243         if view in views:
00244             views.remove(view)
00245             print "REMOVEVIEW", view
00246 
00247 
00248     def startTimer(
00249         self):
00250 
00251         if self.timerActive:
00252             return
00253 
00254         self.timerId = gobject.timeout_add(self.timeDelay, self.tickTimer)
00255         self.timerActive = True
00256 
00257 
00258     def stopTimer(
00259         self):
00260 
00261         # FIXME: Is there some way to immediately cancel self.timerId?
00262 
00263         self.timerActive = False
00264 
00265 
00266     def tickTimer(
00267         self):
00268 
00269         if not self.timerActive:
00270             return False
00271 
00272         self.stopTimer()
00273 
00274         self.tickEngine()
00275 
00276         for view in self.views:
00277             view.tickActiveTool()
00278 
00279         for view in self.views:
00280             view.tickTimer()
00281 
00282         if self.running:
00283             self.startTimer()
00284 
00285         return False
00286 
00287 
00288     def tickEngine(self):
00289 
00290         self.DoRule()
00291         self.updateViews()
00292 
00293 
00294     def updateViews(self):
00295         for view in self.views:
00296             view.updateView()
00297 
00298 
00299     def __repr__(self):
00300         return "<CellModel>"
00301

00305 
00306 def CreateTestEngine():
00307 
00308     # Get our nice scriptable subclass of the SWIG CellEngine wrapper object.
00309     engine = CellModel()
00310 
00311     w = 256
00312     h = 256
00313 
00314     engine.InitScreen(w, h)
00315     engine.SetRect(0, 0, w, h)
00316     engine.wrap = 3
00317     engine.steps = 1
00318     engine.frob = 5
00319     engine.neighborhood = 46
00320     #engine.neighborhood = 37
00321     #engine.LoadRule('WORMS')
00322     engine.Garble()
00323 
00324     return engine
